edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.catalog

Class CourseCatalog

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.catalog.CourseCatalog

  • public class CourseCatalog
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a Course Catalog for the PackScheduler application. There is functionality to add Courses, both in batch and manually, as well as remove Courses, modify the Course listings, and export the catalog to a file.
    Author:
    Steven Mayo

        public CourseCatalog()

    • Method Detail

      • newCourseCatalog

        public void newCourseCatalog()
        Creates a new SortedList container for the course catalog.

      • loadCoursesFromFile

        public void loadCoursesFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Constructs the course catalog by reading in course information from the given filename. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the file cannot be found.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file containing list of students
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file cannot be read from.

      • addCourseToCatalog

        public boolean addCourseToCatalog(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String title,
                                  java.lang.String section,
                                  int credits,
                                  java.lang.String prof,
                                  java.lang.String meetdays,
                                  int start,
                                  int end)
        Attempts to add a new Course to the course catalog. If there is an error creating the Course, then the error is allowed to propagate to the client. The course will only be added if it has valid constructing parameters and is not already in the catalog.
        Parameters:
        name - The Course name
        title - The Course title
        section - The Course section
        credits - The Course credit hours
        prof - The instructor's ID
        meetdays - The meeting days of the Course
        start - The time in standard military that the Course is set to begin.
        end - The time in standard military that the Course is set to end.
        Returns:
        true if the Course can be added to the course catalog.

      • removeCourseFromCatalog

        public boolean removeCourseFromCatalog(java.lang.String name,
                                       java.lang.String section)
        Attempts to remove a course from the Course Catalog, if the name and section parameters match a Course listed in the catalog.
        Parameters:
        name - Course name.
        section - Course section.
        Returns:
        true if the Course was removed from the CourseCatalog.

      • getCourseFromCatalog

        public Course getCourseFromCatalog(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String section)
        Searches through the course catalog and attempts to retrieve a course that matches the name and section parameters that were passed in. If one is not found, then Null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the course to find
        section - section of the course to find.
        Returns:
        Course Course within the course catalog that matches the name and section parameters that were specified or a value of null if one is not found.

      • getCourseCatalog

        public java.lang.String[][] getCourseCatalog()
        Constructs a 2D array containing the course catalog information. There is a row for each course within the catalog and 3 columns for: the course name, the course section, and the course title.
        Returns:
        courseCatalog2d String[][] object containing the name, section, and title for all courses within the course catalog.

      • saveCourseCatalog

        public void saveCourseCatalog(java.lang.String fileName)
        Exports the current course catalog using the filename that's passed in as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the filename to write the course catalog to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an IOException is encountered while attempting to write to/save the file.
